title: Spatial urban data system: A cloud-enabled big data infrastructure for social and economic urban analytics
technology_discussed: Big data; Cloud computing; Geospatial technology
research_description: The article describes the development and implementation of the Spatial Urban Data System (SUDS), a cloud-enabled big data infrastructure designed to support UK-wide urban analytics, focusing on the social and economic aspects of cities. It highlights the use of geospatial technology and cloud computing to generate and integrate synthetic urban metrics, enabling data-driven urban decision-making.
research_results: SUDS provides key insights into intra-city dynamics by generating small-area urban indicators based on real-time or near-real-time data. The system was tested with data from housing, transport, and employment, revealing spatial variations and inequalities in urban services at intra-city levels.
future_research: Future research could focus on the integration of additional data sources, such as IoT and user-generated content, into SUDS to enhance urban predictive analytics and decision-making capabilities.
